column4: anyone know why a video card would work on one computer and not another, both support agp 2x/4x
but on the p3 computer i just have a black screen
its a nvidia 57000 le
trying to install it for a better ubuntu experience =)
did you switch the bios to use agp instead of onbaord (older mobos do not automatically switch it for you)
it doesnt have an onboard video, im currently using an older agp video card on it
when does the black screen kick in? right from power on or from when ubuntu starts loading?
funny thing u say that cause i am also having a problem with the older agp card that works, when ubuntu starts up i get a black screen all the way until the login screen loads up
but with the newer video card its as soon as i power up the machine and i dont get any video at all
if it fails when the login screen loads up then it is to do with the driver selected in xorg.conf
ahhhh, i see, now that is weird...........would be a framebuffer issue yes, but i'm surprised if any card doesnt natively support framebuffer, so sounds more like a hardware issue
i can see grub, but after that i dont see the splash screen with the orange block in the bar going from side to side
yeah i think its a crappy card, thats why i want to get this extra nvidia one i have laying around working on it
so what is the model of the one you want working?
nvidia geforce fx 5700 le 128mb ddr
that should be a perfectly fine card on ubuntu..........so.........with that card, you power on, you see grub.....then black screen.....then login screen appears? can you log into gnome?
no, with this card i dont get any video at all, from power on
meanwhile i can plug it in another computer and it works
and you say it works in another pc?
yes works on another pc
i have no idea to be honest in that case. i suggest maybe checking your bios settings
yeah ill give it another look, only way to do so though is with the older video card plugged in
lol, must be tedious
